column2: First strand cDNA synthesis, random hexamer primers
Nucleic Acid, RNA, total
Nucleic Acid, DNA/RNA hybrid
This protocol is intended for first strand cDNA synthesis using random hexamer primers
http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/0471142727.mb0411s89/abstract;jsessionid=953D32C841D4519C73A9F2BA29307410.d01t01
cDNA synthesis
Random hexamer primers
container

Prepare 100 ng to 1 ug poly(A)+ RNA from the total RNA using an appropriate method (see UNIT 4.5). Keep the poly(A)+ RNA at a concentration of at least 100 ng/ul. See Critical Parameters and Troubleshooting for more details.

column5: See Critical Parameters and Troubleshooting for more details.

column2: Prepare a cocktail on ice containing the following: 50 to 250 ng random hexamer primers. 1 ul 10 mM dNTPs. 100 ng to 1 ug poly(A)+ RNA. Bring the final volume to 12 ul using nuclease-free sterile water, if necessary.

column5: Nucleic Acid, Primer, random hexamer primers

column2: Heat the mixture to 65C in a heat block for 5 min
quick-chill on ice
Collect the contents of the tube by brief centrifugation.

column5: to collect the contents of the tube

column2: Add the following (total volume should be 19 ul): 4 ul 5X first strand buffer (1X final). 2 ul 100 mM DTT (10 mM final). 1 ul nuclease-free water.
Mix by pipetting
collect contents by brief centrifugation.

column5: to collect the contents of the tube
If more than one RNA sample needs to be processed to generate cDNA, one can prepare a master mix containing these components for all the RNA samples at once.

column2: Incubate samples with random- hexamer primers for 2 min at 25C.
Add 1 ul (200 U) of SuperScript II reverse transcriptase
mix gently by flicking
Collect contents by brief centrifugation.

column5: to collect the contents of the tube

column2: For samples with random-hexamer primers incubate for 10 min at 25C followed by 50 min at 42C.
Incubate tubes at 70C for 15 min to inactivate the reverse transcriptase.
Incubate on ice for 2 mins to stop inactivation reaction, from manufactureres protocol

column5: This step based on reagent manufacturers instructions
